unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Making Decisions from Output | 2 of 2
question_text: A veterinarian decided to study the weights (kg) of Siberian and Alaskan huskies. The veterinarian weighted $13$ randomly selected Siberian Huskies and $12$ randomly selected Alaskan Huskies. A two-sample $t$ -test was performed with the results below (two-sided). Two-Sample $t$ for Siberian Husky vs. Alaskan Husky: N Mean StDev SE Mean Siberian Husky 13 18.66 3.89 1.1 Alaskan Husky 12 23.27 2.47 0.71 $\text{Difference }= \mu \text{(Siberian husky)}-\mu \text{(Alaskan husky)}$ Estimate for difference: $-4.61$ $95\%$ confidence interval for difference: $(-7.3, -1.91)$ $\text{T-test of Difference }= 0$ $\text{T-value }= -3.56$ $\text{P-value }= 0.002$ $\text{DF }= 20$ What are the appropriate test statistic and $p$ -value for this problem?
